meanings.definition: To cause to be out of tune or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise untunes the guitar strings.
meanings.sent2: The radio interference untunes the music station.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat untunes the piano by walking on the keys.
meanings.sent4: The storm untunes the peaceful sounds of nature.
meanings.sent5: The careless tuning untunes the entire orchestra performance.

meanings.definition: To disrupt the normal functioning or operation of something.
meanings.sent1: The power outage untunes the electronic devices.
meanings.sent2: The virus untunes the computer system.
meanings.sent3: The prankster untunes the office printer by changing the settings.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor untunes the daily routine.
meanings.sent5: The spilled coffee untunes the morning schedule.
